subject: Re: [junit] How to test console output?
msgSnippet: ... I m not AOP-proficient enough *yet* to suggest such wonderful solutions. :) J. B. Rainsberger, President, Diaspar Software Services Let s write software
messageBody:
>So said Alain Ravet on 2003-07-24 --------------------
>
>J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
>>1. Don't use System.out in your application directly. Your application
>components should accept a PrintWriter as a parameter somewhere.
>>2. In your tests, substitute a PrintWriter wrapping a StringWriter in
>place of System.out. This is easy to verify.
>>
>
>Without providing any code - :) -, I'd suggest you use AspectJ to
>implement solution (2) without modifying the orignal code.
>You would capture all the "System.out.println()" and feed them to a
>StringWriter that you would use in your tests.
>
>If you use IDEA, the eap/under construction version offers - partial -
>AspectJ support.

I'm not AOP-proficient enough *yet* to suggest such wonderful solutions. :)
